name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton

That ruling was not surprising. 

In Federalist 43, James Madison said of future DC residents: “[A] municipal legislature for local purposes, derived from their own suffrages, will of course be allowed them.”

Since 1802, Congress has established various forms of DC gov't. (4/7)

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: In 1953, in the District of Columbia v. John R. Thompson Co., Inc., the Supreme Court said that “there is no constitutional barrier to the delegation by Congress to the District of Columbia of full legislative power.” (3/7)

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton

Under the Constitution, Congress has plenary authority over both DC and the territories. Congress has chosen to give the territories prosecutorial, clemency, and legislative autonomy. Congress should choose to give them to DC, too.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The bill would eliminate the congressional review period for DC legislation. Currently, DC legislation takes effect after a review period, unless a resolution of disapproval is enacted.

Only 3 have been enacted since passage of the Home Rule Act in 1973, and 0 since 1991. (4/5)

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The bill would give DC the authority to grant clemency for DC crimes. Currently, the president exercises the authority to grant clemency for DC crimes—and almost never uses it.

DC should decide whether DC residents deserve mercy. (3/5)

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The bill would give DC the authority to prosecute all DC crimes. Currently, the US Attorney for DC prosecutes most DC crimes committed by adults and some by juveniles.

The prosecutor of DC crimes should be accountable to DC, not to the president. (2/5)

#DCStatehood would end taxation without representation.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Federal taxes are due in one week. DC pays more federal taxes per capita than any state and more federal taxes than 21 states, yet DC residents have no voting representation in Congress.

It is long past time for the Senate to pass the House-passed #DCStatehood bill. https://t.co/qdMpfyediW

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton

All 37 new states were admitted by Congress.

Congress has reduced the size of the fed district.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton

ICYMI: Here is the video of this morning’s historic ceremony unveiling DC’s second statue in the Capitol. DC, like each of the 50 states, now has two statues in the Capitol.

#DCStatehood

https://t.co/tJvbwGASgN https://t.co/vMS34SsteG

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
This afternoon at 4, I will manage bills on the House floor on behalf of @HouseDemocrats.

Watch: https://t.co/UGyJT0oRKq.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “The unveiling of this statue is a milestone in our ongoing march to make D.C. the 51st state.  D.C. residents have more than earned it.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: "In 2020, the House passed the D.C. statehood bill.   Last year, the House passed the bill again, and the Senate held its second-ever hearing on the bill. Today, 54 percent of Americans support statehood for the residents of our nation’s capital.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “D.C. has a larger population than two states.  D.C. pays more federal taxes per capita than any state and more in federal taxes than 21 states.  D.C. residents have served in every American war since the Revolutionary War.  Thirty-thousand current D.C. residents are veterans.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “Yet, the nearly 700,000 D.C. residents are taxed without voting representation in Congress and Congress has complete authority over D.C.’s local affairs. Statehood is the remedy to this denial of democracy.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “Pierre L'Enfant fought in the Revolutionary War, which was launched to end taxation without representation and to give consent to the governed.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “Today, nine years later, D.C. takes its rightful place among the states in the Capitol with the unveiling of the Pierre L'Enfant statue.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “However, Republicans fought my bill, calling it tantamount to granting D.C. statehood.  It took us 11 years to get D.C.’s first statue in the Capitol, of Frederick Douglass, which is displayed in Emancipation Hall.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: “Today’s unveiling was 20 years in the making.  In 2002, I first introduced a bill to give D.C. two statues in the Capitol, as states are entitled to have.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Or it can live up to our nation’s founding principles and pass the #DCStatehood bill.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Congress has a choice. 

It can continue to exclude DC residents from the democratic process, forcing them to watch from the sidelines as Congress votes on federal and DC laws, and to treat them, in the words of Frederick Douglass, as “aliens, not citizens, but subjects.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
DC’s population is larger than two states. 

DC pays *more* federal taxes per capita than any state and pays more federal taxes than 21 states. DC’s gross domestic product is larger than 17 states. 

In 2016, 86 percent of DC residents voted for #DCStatehood.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Our country was founded on the principles of no #taxationwithoutrepresentation and consent of the governed, but DC residents are taxed without representation and cannot consent to the laws under which they, as American citizens, must live.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
.@POTUS Joe Biden strongly supports the #DCStatehood bill and is the first president to put the full weight of the presidency behind the bill in the nation’s history.

Congress has both the moral obligation and the constitutional authority to pass the #DCStatehood bill.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Following in the footsteps of Senator @JoeLieberman, under @SenatorCarper's leadership, the #DCStatehood bill has 45 Senate cosponsors, which is the greatest number of Senate cosponsors of the bill in the nation’s history.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: .@SenatorCarper, I particularly thank you for sponsoring #DCStatehood and for being a champion for DC in the Senate.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: This hearing is of historic significance as only the second Senate hearing on our D.C. statehood bill in the nation’s history.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: .@SenGaryPeters, on behalf of the nearly 700,000 District of Columbia residents, including 30,000 veterans, I thank you for holding today’s hearing and for being an original cosponsor of the #DCStatehood bill.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
.@PurduePharma and the Sackler family clearly preyed on vulnerable populations to line their pockets.  

We must pass the SACKLER Act immediately to ensure that the Sacklers are held accountable for their actions.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Attorney General Wasden, why is it so offensive that Purdue Pharma targeted our nation’s servicemembers?

Attorney General Healey, thousands of copies of deceptive publications like Exit Wounds were distributed in Massachusetts alone.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: This guide included the false statement that, quote, “people who are not predisposed to addiction are unlikely to become addicted to opioid pain medications.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: As part of its marketing efforts toward veterans, Purdue funded and distributed a 2009 book titled, quote, “Exit Wounds:  A survival guide to pain management for returning veterans and their families.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Purdue deliberately marketed opioids to another vulnerable group: military servicemembers.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Should the Sackler family be held accountable for the way @PurduePharma targeted elderly patients using misleading marketing, and simply lied to doctors about OxyContin’s risks?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Attorney General Healey, in your home state of Massachusetts, sales reps allegedly told one doctor that putting elderly patients on OxyContin would improve safety from potential falls—when in reality elderly patients on OxyContin have increased risk of falling and breaking bones.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Mr. Keefe, can tell us what you know about the “geriatric strategy” and Purdue’s efforts to target seniors?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Millions of seniors rely on Medicare Part D to cover the cost of their prescription drugs. According to one internal @PurduePharma document, the company targeted, quote, “patients over the age of 65 as more Medicare Part D coverage is achieved.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: One Purdue supervisor coached sales representatives to follow the company’s quote, “geriatric strategy” when promoting OxyContin providers, and to quote, “keep the focus on the geriatric patients.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Mr. Keefe, your book lays out how the Sacklers’ decades-long legacy of greed, misconduct, and manipulation fueled America’s opioid crisis. https://t.co/QNDEtGi5Oj

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Soon: I'll speak in an @OversightDems hearing on the Sackler Family's role in the opioid crisis and the need for reform.

Watch: https://t.co/H0vITIHEzb

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Perhaps if the public knew as well, Dr. Benaroch’s warning would not have fallen on deaf ears.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Dr. Benaroch knew in 2013 the Rock ‘n Play was dangerous.  

At the time, Mattel also knew that infants had died in the Rock ‘n Play.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: It also demonstrates why it is so important that we repeal Section 6(b) of the Consumer Product Safety Act, and stop letting corporations hide behind the law to hide deaths associated with their products from the public.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
But at the very same time the company was ignoring a pediatrician who raising concerns that the Rock ‘n Play did not provide a safe sleep environment for babies. 

In retrospect, do you think Mattel took Dr. Benaroch’s warning seriously enough?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Mr. Kreiz, let me turn to you.

Mattel and Fisher-Price encourage consumers to consult their pediatricians about providing a safe sleep environment for their babies. Isn’t that right?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Did Fisher-Price issue any sort of warning to the public based on Dr. Benaroch’s concerns?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Mr. Scothon, a Fisher-Price employee, told the Committee that it was highly unusual for a pediatrician to contact the company warning that a product was unsafe.

Did Fisher-Price make any changes to the design of the Rock n’ Play in response to Dr. Benaroch’s warning?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: But even more shocking is the company’s response when a pediatrician proactively reached out to the company to raise the alarm that the Rock ‘n Play was not safe for infant sleep.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: We know that Mattel did not consult a pediatrician when it was designing the Rock ‘n Play to confirm that it was safe for infants to sleep at an incline. https://t.co/BxlIo39bd0

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
I'm speaking at an @Oversight Dems hearing that starts at 11:00 am today on the failure of Fisher-Price to listen to a pediatrician's warning of Rock n' Play dangers and, more generally, failures in infant product safety.
 
Watch: https://t.co/LAUKc5QVnT

tweet_text: Women are equal as drivers on the road, but safety standards do not protect them equally. It’s #timeforchange. Read my press release here: https://t.co/PmYlpzwEM3

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Female car crash victims are 73% more likely to experience serious injury or death than males. This is about more than differences in average height—there are other anatomical differences between males and females that affect how bodies react in a crash.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: I’ll be introducing a bill to require that car crash test dummies be modeled on both male and female bodies. Currently, the federal government only uses crash test dummies modeled on male bodies, and car companies are not required to use dummies modeled on female bodies.

tweet_text:

tweet_text:

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
There are many misconceptions about DC that are used against #DCStatehood. One is that the federal government owns most of the land in DC.

In fact, the federal government owns more land in many states. In Oregon, it's 52.3%.

In DC, the federal government owns just 29%.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: (3/3) #DCTAG students attend colleges and universities in all 50 states. By allowing DC students to attend any state-supported institution, DCTAG provides access to jobs here, where a higher education is necessary for well-paying jobs.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: (2/3) #DCTAG, created by my bill, makes up the difference for DC residents between in-state and out-of-state tuition at public institutions of higher education, and is our top funding priority for DC.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: (1/3) The President’s FY 22 budget has major wins for DC. I am particularly pleased with how it treats #DCTAG: $40 million, increases the annual grant from $10,000 to $15,000, and increases the lifetime grant from $50,000 to $75,000.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
AbbVie’s repeated price increases on Humira have had cost our health care system billions of dollars, and they are simply unsustainable going forward.

We need real structural reforms, like #HR3, if we are going to bring any relief to patients.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
In fact, the net price increased by 110 percent—more than doubling—between 2009 and 2018.  

Dr. Kesselheim, what does this drastic increase in net price say to you about the role, if any, of rebates in driving up Humira’s price over time?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
That means that a year’s supply of Humira now costs over $77,000 dollars. 

Internal data show that Humira’s net price⸺or the list price minus all rebates, discounts, and fees⸺has also increased over time.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Today, the list price of a single 40-milligram syringe of Humira is a $2,984⸺470 percent more than its price at launch.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
You’ll notice that price increases really ramped up after 2013⸺the year AbbVie spun off, and the year you became CEO. 

AbbVie has raised the price of Humira 14 times in just the past 8 years.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Since that time, the increases in price for Humira have only accelerated.

I’d like to show a graph showing how the price of a 40-millgram syringe of Humira has grown from 2003 to today. https://t.co/oztg86WiTE

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Mr. Gonzalez, that’s when you became the CEO, correct?

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
By 2013, a single 40-milligram syringe of the drug was priced at $1,024⸺nearly double what it was ten years earlier.

AbbVie, spun off as its own company in 2013, took Humira with it.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
In 2003, @Abbott_Labs launched Humira at a price of $522 per 40-milligram syringe, or just over $6,200 annually.

Over the course of the next decade, Abbott raised the price of Humira 13 times.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Congress has a choice. It can continue to exclude DC residents from the democratic process, forcing them to watch from the sidelines as Congress votes on federal and #DC laws, and to treat them, in the words of Frederick Douglass, as “aliens, not citizens, but subjects.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:

DC residents have been petitioning for voting representation in Congress and local autonomy for 220 years.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The District Clause gives Congress plenary authority over the federal district and establishes a maximum size of the federal district—100 square miles.
It does not establish a minimum size or a location of the federal district.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The Admissions Clause gives Congress the authority to admit new states. 

All 37 new states were admitted by Congress. 

No state was admitted by constitutional amendment, and no state would have to consent to the admission of the State of Washington, DC.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: This country was founded on the principles of no taxation without representation and consent of the governed, but #DC residents are taxed without representation and cannot consent to the laws under which they, as American citizens, must live.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Richard Holmes made it as far as DC, a walk to freedom but not to equal citizenship so far for our family.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: For me, this is deeply personal. My own family has lived in D.C. since my great-grandfather Richard Holmes, as a slave, walked away from a plantation in Virginia and made his way to DC almost 200 years ago.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The citizens who live in our nation’s capital have never had voting representation on the floor of either chamber of Congress, and Congress has always had the final say on their local affairs. 

This is uniquely un-American and undemocratic.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: For the 220 years since DC became the capital of the United States, DC residents, who have always had all of the obligations of citizenship, including paying full federal taxes and serving in the armed forces, have been excluded from much of American democracy.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Last Congress, when the House passed the #DCStatehood bill, it was the first time in history either chamber of Congress had passed it. 

This Congress, with Democrats controlling the House, Senate and @WhiteHouse, DC statehood is within reach for the first time in history.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: The rule before us today is no ordinary rule. It is the prelude to history, and I use that word advisedly.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: RT @RepBobbyRush: The fact that more than 712,000 D.C. residents — a majority of them Black — are being denied a voice in Congress is an af…

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
RT @RepJimmyGomez: 700,000 #DC residents deserve statehood and a vote in Congress. Plain and simple.

Tune into our @OversightDems’ markup…

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Or it can live up to the nation’s promise and ideals, end taxation without representation and pass #DCStatehood.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Congress can continue to exercise autocratic authority over the American citizens who reside in our nation’s capital, treating them, in the words of Frederick Douglass, the inspiration for the name of the new state, as “aliens, not citizens, but subjects.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: DC servicemembers have helped get voting rights for people throughout the world, yet have always been denied those same rights when they returned home.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: As American citizens, DC residents are entitled to equal citizenship, but they have also earned it. They have fought in every American war, including the war that led to the creation of the nation, the Revolutionary War.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
My own family has lived in DC since my great-grandfather Richard Holmes, as a slave, walked away from a plantation in Virginia and made his way to DC almost 200 years ago.

Richard Holmes made it as far as DC, a walk to freedom but not to equal citizenship so far for our family.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
DC pays more federal taxes per capita than any state and pays more federal taxes than 21 states. 

DC has a gross domestic product larger than 17 states. 

DC's bond rating is higher than the rating of 32 states.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: DC's population is larger than two states, and the State of Washington, DC would be one of seven states with a population under one million.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Although #DC does have car dealerships, notably, the Framers left car dealerships out of the Admissions Clause, and, until last month’s hearing on #DCStatehood, the number of car dealerships had never been raised as an element in admission decisions.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Congress generally has considered three elements in admission decisions: population and resources, support for statehood and commitment to democracy.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: These two days remind us that D.C. residents are taxed without voting representation in Congress and are denied equal political rights.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Today's #DCStatehood markup could not be more timely.

Tomorrow is the traditional federal tax filing deadline, and Friday is Emancipation Day, which celebrates the freeing of 3,100 enslaved persons in D.C. in 1862.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
#DCStatehood has both the Constitution and facts on its side. 

The Constitution’s Admissions Clause gives Congress the authority to admit new states, but a new state may not be created from an existing state without the existing state’s consent.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: America was founded on the principles of no taxation without representation and consent of the governed, but the United States is the only democratic country that denies voting representation in the national legislature to the residents of the capital.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Congress has both the constitutional authority and moral obligation to pass #DCStatehood.

The Constitution gives Congress the authority to admit new states, which it has done 37 times, and to reduce the size of the federal district, which it did by 30 percent in 1846.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Yesterday’s revelations further expose the hypocrisy of the man who currently holds the highest office in the country.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: #DC residents pay the highest taxes per capita, yet President #Trump has repeatedly attacked the idea that the residents of our nation’s capital deserve a vote in Congress.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: At its core, the argument for D.C. statehood, which overwhelmingly passed in the House of Representatives in June, is the rallying cry of the Revolutionary War: #NoTaxationWithoutRepresentation.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: The news about President Trump’s taxes yesterday – he paid a total of $750 in federal income taxes during his first year in office despite repeatedly bragging that he is a billionaire – makes his attacks on #DCStatehood even more outrageous.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: By holding this hearing today, we ensure that the DBE program and the business owners it lifts up receive thorough consideration by this Committee.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: This program, when properly administered and enforced, ensures that businesses owned by women and minorities have a fair chance to compete for federally assisted transportation contracts.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: One of the most powerful tools in the field of transportation and construction to assist people who have routinely been left out or left behind is the U.S. Department of Transportation’s Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) Program.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: I've spent my entire career - in Congress, and as Chair of the @USEEOC before that - fighting for equality and seeking to break down barriers so that truly all citizens have the same opportunities to participate and thrive in our economy and our society.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Over the last few months, the vulnerability of people of color has been unmistakably demonstrated as we ride wave after wave of crisis – a global pandemic, a tanking economy, and systemic racism repeatedly manifesting as physical violence.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: We are at a pivotal moment in our Nation’s history. We are shining a long overdue light on the lived realities for people of color in this country, despite our pledge of “liberty and justice for all.”

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Thank you, Chair @RepPeterDeFazio, for holding this important hearing. Today presents a welcome opportunity to elevate the realities of minority and women-owned business owners.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: RT @TransportDems: “One of the most powerful tools in the field of transportation and construction to assist people who have been routinely…

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: On this difficult day, I call on Senate Republicans to step up and pass legislation to save Americans. Nothing is more important. Pass the #Heroes Act.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: Today, we reached a deplorable and avoidable landmark: More than 200,000 Americans have died from COVID-19; 622 of them in #DC. We can and must do more to save the lives of Americans from this cruel virus.

#USPSSabotage

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
#DeJoy is saying that some of this, taking the sorting machines out, was planned.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The problem at the moment is the delivery of mail. 

In fact the mail was being delivered, but we have had the intervention of #PostmasterGeneralDeJoy to stop it. 

Unacceptable.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
"Help. Help. Help." 

-- #ANCCommissioner Carmon of #Ward8 on the problems with #USPS deliveries experienced lately.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: This delivery problem is being felt in our communities, and yet we have not heard their voices. While I've heard from people across the city, I've heard the most consistent essential delivery problems from my constituents in #Ward8.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: I'm grateful to the #ANCCommissioners coming forward today, Commissioner Carmon of Ward 8D and Commissioner Adofo of Ward 8C, and to the two postal worker union representatives who joined us today, Mr. Robinson from the @APWUnational and Mr. Hooks from @NALC_National.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
But what is needed now is an understanding of what #PostmasterGeneralDeJoy's interference means on the ground. 

We won't be able to fix what has gone wrong with #USPS until we hear from those most affected.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: We can still prevent an indelible scar on our free elections that will result from changes @USPS. We must pass the #DeliveringforAmericaAct and the $25 billion needed to save the #USPS.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: As far as I am concerned, the job is still to be done.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: #DeJoy has admitted that the harm done so far will be left in place -- no replacement of sorting machines or of blue mailboxes that have been removed, and no promise for adequate #USPS overtime.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:

Missing from the discussion are voices of the people on the #frontlines, our elected #ANCcommissioners, and our #PostalWorkers, who hold the bulk of the burden @USPS is facing.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The House passed our #DCStatehood bill in June. 

The Senate must stop denying our 705,000 federal taxpaying residents congressional voting rights and full local self-government.

#DCStatehood now.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
An act of Congress admitted all 37 new states. 
There is no constitutional, financial, or historical reason Congress can’t or shouldn’t make DC a state. 

#DCStatehood now.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
DC pays more federal taxes per capita than any state and more total federal taxes than 22 states. 

The U.S. sends DC residents to war but denies them congressional voting rights and full local self-government. 

#DCStatehood now.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
The United States is the only democratic country that denies the residents of the nation’s capital *both* voting rights in the national legislature and full local self-government.

#DCStatehood now.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text:
Wyoming has 578,000 residents and three voting members of the House and Senate. 

Vermont has 623,000 residents and three voting members of the House and Senate. 

D.C. has 705,000 residents and zero voting members of the House or Senate. 

#DCStatehood now.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: The House passed our #DCStatehood bill on June 26. The Senate has not yet acted. Our 705,000+ federal taxpaying residents deserve equal congressional voting rights and full local self-government. Retweet if you agree DC needs statehood now. https://t.co/R0HT3RbT0M

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: The mission during the remainder of this Congress is clear. We need to educate the American public about #DCStatehood, and we need to build support for the D.C. statehood bill in the Senate. Today’s @SenateDems hearing is a great start.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: The Senate can continue to exercise undemocratic authority over the citizens who reside in our nation’s capital, treating them, in the words of #FrederickDouglass, as “aliens, not citizens, but subjects.” Or it can live up to our nation’s promise and ideals and pass #DCStatehood.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: #DCStatehood is deeply personal for me. My great-grandfather Richard Holmes, who escaped as a slave from a Virginia plantation, made it to D.C., a walk to freedom but not to equality. For three generations my family has been denied the rights other Americans take for granted.

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
tweet_text: The United States is the only democratic country that denies both voting rights in the national legislature and local autonomy to the residents of its nation’s capital. The Senate has both the constitutional authority and moral obligation to end this injustice. #DCStatehood

name: Eleanor #DCStatehood Holmes Norton
